revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=July 2018}} {{Spanish name|Deulofeu|Lázaro}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Gerard Deulofeu | image = Gerard Deulofeu (1).jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Deulofeu playing for [[Spain national under-19 football team|Spain U19]] in 2012 | fullname = Gerard Deulofeu Lázaro<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/news/news/2013-14/aug/premier-league-squad-numbers-seasons-2013-14.html |title=Barclays Premier League squad numbers 2013/14 |publisher=Premier League |date=16 August 2013 |accessdate=17 August 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130925003258/http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/news/news/2013-14/aug/premier-league-squad-numbers-seasons-2013-14.html |archivedate=25 September 2013}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1994|3|13|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Riudarenes]], Spain | height = 1.77 m<ref>http://www.gdeulofeu.com/gerard/</ref> | position = [[Forward (association football)|Forward]] | currentclub = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] | clubnumber = 7 | youthyears1 = 2001–2003 | youthclubs1 = Penya Bons Aires | youthyears2 = 2003–2011 | youthclubs2 = [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] | years1 = 2011–2013 | clubs1 = [[FC Barcelona B|Barcelona B]] | caps1 = 68 | goals1 = 27 | years2 = 2011–2015 | clubs2 = [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] | caps2 = 2 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2013–2014 | clubs3 = → [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] (loan) | caps3 = 25 | goals3 = 3 | years4 = 2014–2015 | clubs4 = → [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] (loan) | caps4 = 17 | goals4 = 1 | years5 = 2015–2017 | clubs5 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | caps5 = 37 | goals5 = 2 | years6 = 2017 | clubs6 = → [[A.C. Milan|Milan]] (loan) | caps6 = 17 | goals6 = 4 | years7 = 2017–2018 | clubs7 = [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] | caps7 = 10 | goals7 = 1 | years8 = 2018 | clubs8 = → [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] (loan) | caps8 = 7 | goals8 = 1 | years9 = 2018– | clubs9 = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] | caps9 = 20 | goals9 = 6 | nationalyears1 = 2009–2010 | nationalteam1 = [[Spain national under-16 football team|Spain U16]] | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | nationalyears2 = 2009–2011 | nationalteam2 = [[Spain national under-17 football team|Spain U17]] | nationalcaps2 = 21 | nationalgoals2 = 6 | nationalyears3 = 2011–2012 | nationalteam3 = [[Spain national under-19 football team|Spain U19]] | nationalcaps3 = 19 | nationalgoals3 = 5 | nationalyears4 = 2013 | nationalteam4 = [[Spain national under-20 football team|Spain U20]] | nationalcaps4 = 7 | nationalgoals4 = 3 | nationalyears5 = 2012–2017 | nationalteam5 = [[Spain national under-21 football team|Spain U21]] | nationalcaps5 = 36 | nationalgoals5 = 17 | nationalyears6 = 2014– | nationalteam6 = [[Spain national football team|Spain]] | nationalcaps6 = 4 | nationalgoals6 = 1 | nationalyears7 = 2014– | nationalteam7 = [[Catalonia national football team|Catalonia]] | nationalcaps7 = 1 | nationalgoals7 = 0 | club-update = 23:03, 22 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 5 September 2017 }} '''Gerard Deulofeu Lázaro''' ({{IPA-es|ɟʝeˈɾaɾ ðeuloˈfeu ˈlaθaɾo|lang}};{{efn-ua|In isolation, ''Deulofeu'' is pronounced {{IPA-es|deuloˈfeu|}}.}} born 13 March 1994) is a Spanish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Premier League]] club [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] and the [[Spain national football team|Spain national team]]. Mainly a [[Forward (association football)|forward]], he can also play as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] on both flanks.
He started his career with Barcelona, first appearing with the first team at the age of 17, and was loaned to [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] and [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] before joining the former on a permanent deal in the summer of 2015. After a successful loan spell at Italian side [[A.C. Milan|Milan]], he was brought back to Barcelona in June 2017.
Deulofeu was also a [[Spain national youth football team|Spanish youth international]], having represented the country over 80 times at [[Spain national under-16 football team|under-16]], [[Spain national under-17 football team|under-17]], [[Spain national under-19 football team|under-19]], [[Spain national under-20 football team|under-20]] and [[Spain national under-21 football team|under-21 levels]], being named the [[UEFA European Under-19 Championship#Under-19 Golden Player|UEFA Under-19 Championship Golden Player]] in [[2012 UEFA European Under-19 Championship|2012]]. In 2014, he made his debut for the [[Spain national football team]].
==Club career== ===Barcelona=== Born in [[Riudarenes]], [[Province of Girona|Girona]], [[Catalonia]], Deulofeu joined [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]]'s [[La Masia|youth academy]] in 2003 at the age of nine.<ref name="prebarca">{{cite web|url=http://www.diaridegirona.cat/esports/2010/11/04/retorn-penya-bons-aires/443253.html|title=El retorn de la Penya Bons Aires|language=Catalan|publisher=Diari de Girona|accessdate=12 March 2017}}</ref> In 2005, he was promoted to the U-13 team.<ref name="TOP">{{cite web|url=http://www.footballtop.com/players/gerard-deulofeu|title=Gerard Deulofeu. Biography|publisher=Football Top|accessdate=28 January 2014}}</ref> On 2 March 2011, still registered with the junior team, he made his senior debut, appearing for the [[FC Barcelona B|B-team]] in a 4–1 away win against [[Córdoba CF|Córdoba]] in [[Segunda División]] by coming on as a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] for [[Eduard Oriol]] in the 75th minute.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.com/web/castellano/noticies/futbol_b/temporada10-11/03/02/n110302116044.html |title=Deulofeu debuta en Segunda A |trans-title=Deulofeu makes Second Division debut |publisher=Barcelona's official website |language=Spanish |date=2 March 2011 |accessdate=29 November 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130102125832/http://www.fcbarcelona.com/web/castellano/noticies/futbol_b/temporada10-11/03/02/n110302116044.html |archivedate=2 January 2013 }}</ref>
In late April 2011, Deulofeu was called up to the senior squad for the first time, for a [[La Liga]] match against [[Real Sociedad]] on 29 April,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.com/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada10-11/04/29/n110429117160.html |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130102125811/http://www.fcbarcelona.com/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada10-11/04/29/n110429117160.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2 January 2013 |title=Gerard Deulofeu makes squad debut |publisher=Barcelona's official website |first=Jaume |last=Marcet |date=29 April 2011 |accessdate=29 November 2013 }}</ref> but did not leave the bench in a 1–2 away loss. On 3 August he made his Barcelona first-team debut, in a 1–4 [[Exhibition game|friendly]] loss against [[C.D. Guadalajara|Guadalajara]]; three days later, against [[Club América]], he [[Assist (football)|assisted]] [[Seydou Keita (footballer)|Seydou Keita]] in the 90th minute of a 2–0 win.
On 16 September 2012, Deulofeu scored his first goal as a senior, in a 1–2 loss at [[Hércules CF|Hércules]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.com/web/castellano/noticies/futbol_b/temporada11-12/09/16/n110916119262.html |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120914164651/http://www.fcbarcelona.com/web/castellano/noticies/futbol_b/temporada11-12/09/16/n110916119262.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=14 September 2012 |title=El filial se abona al infortunio (2–1) |trans-title=B-team marries misfortune (2–1) |publisher=Barcelona's official website |language=Spanish |first=Jaume |last=Marcet |date=16 September 2011 |accessdate=29 November 2013 }}</ref> On 29 October he made his first official appearance with the main squad, replacing [[Cesc Fàbregas]] in the 63rd minute of a 5–0 league home success against [[RCD Mallorca|Mallorca]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/323935?cc=5739|title=Messi to the fore once again|publisher=[[ESPN FC]]|date=29 October 2011|accessdate=29 November 2013}}</ref>
Deulofeu scored 18 goals for the B's in the [[2012–13 Segunda División|2012–13 season]], joint-fourth in the second level competition. On 15 May 2013 he signed a professional contract with the ''Blaugrana ''first team, running until June 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.com/football/barca-b/detail/article/gerard-deulofeu-s-best-goals-for-fc-barcelona|title=Gerard Deulofeu's best goals for FC Barcelona|publisher=Barcelona's official website|date=15 May 2013|accessdate=29 November 2013}}</ref>
====Everton (loan)==== On 10 July 2013, [[Premier League]] side [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] signed Deulofeu on a [[2013–14 Premier League|season]]-long [[loan (sports)|loan]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/archive/2013/07/10/blues-sign-barca-starlet|title=Blues sign Barça starlet|publisher=Everton F.C|date=10 July 2013|accessdate=10 July 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/jul/10/everton-sign-gerard-deulofeu-barcelona|title=Everton sign Barcelona starlet Gerard Deulofeu on season-long loan|work=[[The Guardian]]|date=10 July 2013|accessdate=10 July 2013}}</ref> The ''[[Liverpool Daily Post & Echo|Liverpool Echo]]'' also reported that any loan fee would be waived if he made appearances in more than 50% of his new club's games.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/barcelona-back-roberto-martinezs-everton-5163542|title=Barcelona back Martinez's Blues vision with Deulofeu loan|work=[[Liverpool Daily Post & Echo|Liverpool Echo]]|last=O'Keeffe|first=Greg|date=20 July 2013|accessdate=21 July 2013}}</ref> He scored on his debut for his new club, a 2–1 home win over [[Stevenage F.C.|Stevenage]] in [[2013–14 Football League Cup|the second round]] of the [[Football League Cup]] on 29 August.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23776650|title=Everton 2–1 Stevenage|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=28 August 2013|accessdate=29 August 2013}}</ref>
On 30 November, Deulofeu scored his first league goal for the Toffees, netting the opener in a 4–0 home success against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25063878|title=Everton 4–0 Stoke City|publisher=BBC Sport|date=30 November 2013|accessdate=2 December 2013}}</ref> His second came eight days later, through an 85th-minute strike at [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] to earn a 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25173164|title=Arsenal 1–1 Everton|publisher=BBC Sport|date=8 December 2013|accessdate=9 December 2013}}</ref>
On 14 December 2013, Deulofeu suffered a [[hamstring]] injury during Everton's 4–1 victory over [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]], which sidelined him for five weeks.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2526605/Everton-forward-Gerard-Deulofeu-weeks.html|title=Deulofeu set to return to Spain for treatment as he faces eight weeks out|work=[[Daily Mail]]|last=Bretland|first=Elliott|date=19 December 2013|accessdate=5 February 2014}}</ref> He scored his third and last goal on 15 March of the following year, netting the opener in a 2–1 home win over [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26493214|title=Everton 2–1 Cardiff|publisher=BBC Sport|last=McGowan|first=Alistair|date=15 March 2014|accessdate=25 May 2014}}</ref> He helped his team to record its best ever Premier League points tally of 72 to finish fifth<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/archive/2014/05/14/magic-numbers-roberto-s-record-breakers|title=Magic numbers: Roberto's record-breakers|publisher=[[Everton F.C.]]|date=14 May 2014|accessdate=26 May 2014}}</ref> and, at the end of the campaign, Barcelona confirmed that he would not be returning for a second loan spell as he had been promoted to their first-team squad;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2633042/Gerard-Deulofeu-return-Barcelona-season-long-loan-spell-Everton.html|title=Gerard Deulofeu will return to Barcelona after season-long loan spell with Everton|work=Daily Mail|date=19 May 2014|accessdate=26 May 2014}}</ref> he wrote an [[open letter]] thanking the staff, players and fans for their support during his stay.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/gerard-deulofeu-says-goodbye-everton-3593340|title=Gerard Deulofeu says goodbye to Everton fans in open letter as he makes Barcelona return|work=[[Daily Mirror]]|date=23 May 2014|accessdate=26 May 2014}}</ref>
====Sevilla (loan)==== [[File:Barça - Napoli - 20140806 - 37.jpg|thumb|250px|Deulofeu taking on [[SSC Napoli|Napoli]]'s [[Giandomenico Mesto]] in an August 2014 friendly]] In May 2014, Deulofeu was granted a first-team place by new Barcelona manager [[Luis Enrique (footballer)|Luis Enrique]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Guy|first1=Peter|title=Barcelona new boss Luis Enrique insists Gerard Deulofeu will be in his first team squad|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/barcelona-new-boss-luis-enrique-7143516|accessdate=25 August 2014|work=[[Liverpool Echo]]|date=20 May 2014}}</ref> However, on 14 August 2014, [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]] reached an agreement with Barcelona for the loan of Deulofeu for the coming season,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sevillafc.es/nuevaweb/actualidad/noticias/34324/sevilla-fc-y-fc-barcelona-llegan-a-un-principio-de-acuerdo-para-la-cesion-de-deulofeu |title=Sevilla FC Y FC Barcelona llegan a un principio de acuerdo para la cesión de Deulofeu |trans-title=Sevilla FC and FC Barcelona reach an agreement for the loan of Deulofeu |publisher=Sevilla's official website |language=Spanish |date=14 August 2014 |accessdate=17 August 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140816170509/http://www.sevillafc.es/nuevaweb/actualidad/noticias/34324/sevilla-fc-y-fc-barcelona-llegan-a-un-principio-de-acuerdo-para-la-cesion-de-deulofeu |archivedate=16 August 2014 }}</ref> with the player admitting "surprise" at Enrique's decision.<ref>{{cite news|title=La Liga: Gerard Deulofeu admits surprise at Barcelona exit|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11095/9430263/la-liga-gerard-deulofeu-admits-surprise-at-barcelona-exit|accessdate=25 August 2014|work=Sky Sports News|date=19 August 2014}}</ref>
After being an unused substitute in a 1–1 home draw against [[Valencia CF|Valencia]], Deulofeu made his debut on 30 August replacing [[Vitolo (footballer, born 1989)|Vitolo]] in the 73rd minute of a 2–1 away win against [[RCD Espanyol|Espanyol]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Espanyol 1–2 Sevilla|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/match/espanyol-vs-sevilla/1821357?ICID=RE|accessdate=31 August 2014|work=Goal.com|date=30 August 2014}}</ref> He made his [[UEFA Europa League]] debut on 18 September, starting and providing assists for both goals in a 2–0 home victory against [[Feyenoord Rotterdam|Feyenoord]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2015/matches/round=2000587/match=2014444/postmatch/report/ |title=Quick-fire Sevilla catch Feyenoord cold |publisher=UEFA |date=18 September 2014 |accessdate=18 September 2014 }}</ref>
On 24 September Deulofeu scored his first goal for the [[Andalusia]]ns (and also his first ever in the top flight in Spain), netting the game's winner in a home success over [[Real Sociedad]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.insidespanishfootball.com/126604/sevilla-1-0-real-sociedad-deulofeu-scores-first-primera-goal-as-sevilla-become-joint-la-liga-leaders/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140926015351/http://www.insidespanishfootball.com/126604/sevilla-1-0-real-sociedad-deulofeu-scores-first-primera-goal-as-sevilla-become-joint-la-liga-leaders/ |dead-url=yes |archive-date=26 September 2014 |title=Sevilla 1–0 Real Sociedad: Deulofeu scores first Primera goal as Sevilla become joint La Liga leaders |work=Inside Spanish Football |date=24 September 2014 |accessdate=24 September 2014 }}</ref> His loan was considered hugely unsuccessful, the Spanish newspaper ''[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]'' selected him in their La Liga 'Worst team of the season'.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3096094/Thomas-Vermaelen-named-Spanish-league-WORST-team-season-despite-playing-just-one-game-Barcelona.html |title=Thomas Vermaelen named in Spanish league WORST team of the season despite playing just one game for Barcelona|work=Daily Mail |date=25 May 2015 |accessdate=25 May 2015 }}</ref>
===Everton=== Deulofeu joined Everton permanently on 1 July 2015,<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/06/25/deulofeu-returns|title = Deulofeu Returns|accessdate = 25 June 2015|publisher = Everton F.C.}}</ref> for a transfer fee reported to be £4.2 million.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Everton confirm £4.2m capture of Barcelona winger Gerard Deulofeu|url = https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/jun/25/gerard-deulofeu-everton-barcelona-three-year-contract|website = The Guardian|accessdate = 25 June 2015|agency = Press Association}}</ref> He scored his first goal as a permanent Everton player, a free kick at the [[Madejski Stadium]], as they came from behind to win 2–1 against [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] in the third round of the [[Football League Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Reading 1–2 Everton: Gerard Deulofeu's free-kick sends Premier League side through|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/reading-vs-everton/351320|accessdate=12 November 2015|publisher=Sky Sports|date=22 September 2015}}</ref> His first league goal since his transfer came on 1 November, the opening goal in a 6–2 rout of [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Magowan|first1=Alistair|title=Everton 6–2 Sunderland|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34630289|accessdate=12 November 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 November 2015}}</ref>
====Milan (loan)==== On 23 January 2017, Deulofeu joined [[A.C. Milan|Milan]] on loan until the end of the 2016–17 season.<ref>{{cite news|title=Deulofeu Loaned To AC Milan |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/01/23/deulofeu-loaned-to-milan |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=23 January 2017 |accessdate=23 January 2017}}</ref> Two days later, he made his debut with Milan in a [[Coppa Italia]] [[2016–17 Coppa Italia|quarter-final]] match against [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]], coming on as a substitute for [[Carlos Bacca]] in the 1–2 defeat.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.legaseriea.it/it/tim-cup/match-report/2016-17/QUART/UNI/1/JUVMIL|title=Calendario e Risultati <nowiki>|</nowiki> Stagione 2016–17 <nowiki>|</nowiki> Quarti|language=Italian|publisher=Lega Serie A|date=25 January 2017|accessdate=26 January 2017}}</ref> On 29 January, he made his league debut as a substitute for the injured [[Giacomo Bonaventura]] in a loss by the same score against [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.legaseriea.it/it/serie-a-tim/match-report/2016-17/UNICO/UNI/22/UDIMIL|title=Calendario e Risultati <nowiki>|</nowiki> Stagione 2016–17 <nowiki>|</nowiki> 22^ Giornata|language=Italian|publisher=Lega Serie A|date=29 January 2017|accessdate=30 January 2017}}</ref> On 8 February, Deulofeu made his first assist, a low pass across the goalmouth towards [[Mario Pašalić]], in a 0–1 away victory against [[Bologna F.C. 1909|Bologna]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.legaseriea.it/it/serie-a-tim/match-report/2016-17/UNICO/UNI/18/BOLMIL|title=Calendario e Risultati <nowiki>|</nowiki> Stagione 2016–17 <nowiki>|</nowiki> 18^ Giornata|language=Italian|publisher=Lega Serie A|date=8 February 2017|accessdate=12 February 2017}}</ref> and 11 days later he scored his first goal for the ''Rossoneri'' in a 2–1 victory against [[ACF Fiorentina|Fiorentina]] at the [[San Siro]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.legaseriea.it/it/serie-a-tim/match-report/2016-17/UNICO/UNI/25/MILFIO|title=Calendario e Risultati <nowiki>|</nowiki> Stagione 2016–17 <nowiki>|</nowiki> 25^ Giornata|language=Italian|publisher=Lega Serie A|date=19 February 2017|accessdate=21 February 2017}}</ref>
===Return to Barcelona=== On 30 June 2017, Deulofeu returned to [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]], as the club activated their buy-back clause for him.<ref>{{cite news|title=FC Barcelona exercises their right to buy Gerard Deulofeu back|url=https://www.fcbarcelona.com/football/first-team/news/2017-2018/signing-fc-barcelona-exercises-their-right-to-buy-gerard-deulofeu-back |publisher=FC Barcelona |date=30 June 2017 |accessdate=30 June 2017}}</ref> On 21 October, he scored his first goal for the club as he scored the opener in the 2nd minute in a 2–0 win against [[Málaga CF|Málaga]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Gerard Deulofeu fires his first Barcelona goal to spark win over Málaga|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/oct/21/barcelona-malaga-la-liga-match-report|website=[[The Guardian]]|accessdate=21 October 2017|date=21 October 2017}}</ref>
===Watford=== On 29 January 2018, it was announced that Deulofeu was to join [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] on a loan deal until the end of the season.<ref>{{cite web|title=Agreement with Watford for Deulofeu loan move|url=https://www.fcbarcelona.com/football/first-team/news/2017-2018/agreement-with-watford-for-deulofeu-loan-move|accessdate=29 January 2018}}</ref> On 5 February 2018, he scored his first goal with Watford in a [[2017-18 Premier League|Premier League]] 4–1 win against [[Chelsea Football Club|Chelsea]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Gerard Deulofeu inspires Watford to runaway win against 10-man Chelsea|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/feb/05/watford-chelsea-premier-league-match-report|accessdate=5 February 2018}}</ref>
On 11 June 2018, Watford signed Deulofeu on a permanent deal for a reported fee of €13 million.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.goal.com/en/news/watford-sign-deulofeu-from-barcelona-for-13m/1rskzd1rltd2i1x73qcsci8w5t |title= Watford sign Deulofeu from Barcelona for €13m |publisher= Goal.com |accessdate=11 June 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://talksport.com/football/watford-sign-gerard-deulofeu-barcelona-official-announcement-expected-next-week-reports|title=Watford sign Gerard Deulofeu from Barcelona with official announcement expected next week - reports|publisher=talksport|accessdate=11 June 2018}}</ref> He was sidelined from the last game of his loan spell until being available for selection again in early October, owing to "foot and hip problems".<ref name = "NBC">{{cite news|title=Watford’s Deulofeu finally ready for selection|first=Daniel|last=Karell|date=4 October 2018|accessdate=5 October 2018|work=soccer.nbcsports.com|publisher=NBC Sports|url=https://soccer.nbcsports.com/2018/10/04/watfords-deulofeu-finally-ready-for-selection/}}</ref>
On 22 February 2019, Deulofeu became the first Watford player to score a [[List of Premier League hat-tricks|Premier League hat-trick]], scoring three goals in a 5-1 win over [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/47248480|title=Cardiff 1-5 Watford: Gerard Deulofeu scores hat-trick in Watford victory|date=2019-02-22|access-date=2019-02-23|language=en-GB}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Jesé Rodríguez and Gerard Deloufeu.jpg|thumb|Deulofeu (underneath) celebrates [[Jesé]]'s goal against [[Portugal national under-19 football team|Portugal]] at the [[2012 UEFA European Under-19 Championship]].]] Deulofeu played for the [[Spain national under-17 football team|Spanish under-17 team]] from 2009 to 2011, helping them finish runner-up at the [[2010 UEFA European Under-17 Football Championship|2010 UEFA European Championship]]. In the latter year he was selected to the [[Spain national under-19 football team|under-19s]], winning two consecutive [[UEFA European Under-19 Championship|European Championships]] and being selected best player in [[2012 UEFA European Under-19 Championship|the 2012 edition]].<ref name="TOP"/>
Deulofeu was selected for [[Spain national football team|the senior side]] for the first time on 30 May 2014, as part of a 19-man squad to play a friendly against [[Bolivia national football team|Bolivia]], being given the number 7.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27565470|title=World Cup 2014: Gerard Deulofeu called up by Spain for friendly|publisher=BBC Sport|date=25 May 2014|accessdate=25 May 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.sefutbol.com/estos-son-dorsales-que-luciran-nuestros-internacionales-bolivia|title=Oficial: Estos son los dorsales que lucirán nuestros internacionales ante Bolivia|trans-title=Official: These are the jerseys our internationals will sport against Bolivia|publisher=Sefutbol|language=Spanish|date=27 May 2014|accessdate=27 May 2014}}</ref> He played the last ten minutes of the 2–0 win in [[Seville]] as a substitute for [[Pedro (footballer, born 1987)|Pedro]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.mundodeportivo.com/20140530/futbol/seleccion-espanola/2-0-iniesta-desatasca-a-espana-en-sevilla_54408531208.html|title=2–0: Iniesta desatasca a España en Sevilla|trans-title=2–0: Iniesta gets Spain going in Seville|work=[[El Mundo Deportivo (newspaper)|El Mundo Deportivo]]|language=Spanish|date=31 May 2014|accessdate=2 June 2014}}</ref> but the following day he was not included in [[2014 FIFA World Cup squads#Spain|the squad]] for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27647635|title=World Cup 2014: Spain drop Alvaro Negredo and Jesus Navas|publisher=BBC Sport|date=31 May 2014|accessdate=31 May 2014}}</ref>
On 12 November 2015, Deulofeu scored a [[hat-trick]] and [[captain (association football)|captain]]ed the [[Spain national under-21 football team|under-21 team]] in a 5–0 win over [[Georgia national under-21 football team|Georgia]] in [[Almería]], for [[2017 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Beesley|first1=Chris|title=Everton FC: Gerard Deulofeu scores a hat-trick|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/everton-fc-gerard-deulofeu-scores-10437413|accessdate=12 November 2015|work=Liverpool Echo|date=12 November 2015}}</ref>
Winning his second senior Spain [[cap (sport)|cap]], Deulofeu scored his first goal for Spain against [[France national football team|France]] in a friendly on 28 March 2017, after coming off the bench.<ref name="NFT" /> However, the goal was initially ruled out for [[Offside (association football)|offside]], but the [[Referee (association football)|referee]] consulted his [[video assistant referee|video assistant]], who after checking the TV replays decided the [[Assistant referee (association football)|referee's assistant]] had made the wrong call in the first place.<ref>{{cite news|work=Planet Futbol|publisher=Sports Illustrated|title=VAR disallows Griezmann goal, gives Deulofeu one in Spain's win vs. France|date=28 March 2017|accessdate=5 October 2018|url=https://www.si.com/planet-futbol/2017/03/28/france-spain-friendly-video-goals-mbappe-griezmann-pedro-iniesta}}</ref> Deulofeu made two further appearances for Spain as a substitute in 2017, in a 2–2 friendly draw against [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]] and an 8–0 victory over [[Liechtenstein national football team|Liechtenstein]] in [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification]]: the latter match marked Deulofeu's competitive international debut.<ref name="NFT" />
===International goals=== :''Scores and results list Spain's goal tally first.''<ref name="NFT">{{cite web|url=http://www.national-football-teams.com/player/55598/Gerard_Deulofeu.html|title=Deulofeu, Gerard|publisher=National Football Teams|accessdate=28 March 2017}}</ref>
{| class="wikitable" style="font-size:100%;" ! No !! Date !! Venue !! Opponent !! Score !! Result !! Competition |- | 1. || 28 March 2017 || [[Stade de France]], [[Saint-Denis, Seine-Saint-Denis|Saint-Denis]], France || {{fb|FRA}} || align=center | '''2'''–0 || align=center | 2–0 || [[Exhibition game#Association football|Friendly]] |}
==Style of play== A quick and skilful player, gifted with pace, good technique and [[Dribbling#Association football|dribbling]] ability, Deulofeu is capable of playing as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] or as a [[forward (association football)|forward]] on either flank.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/meet-men-who-could-be-prem-stars-christmas|title=Meet the men who could be Prem stars by Christmas|publisher=FourFourTwo|author1=Jonathan Fadugba|date=16 August 2013|accessdate=22 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Milan: Deulofeu il più forte della storia, mix esplosivo tra Kakà e Ronaldinho|url=http://www.calciomercato.com/news/milan-deulofeu-il-piu-forte-della-storia-38047|publisher=Calciomercato.com|accessdate=22 February 2017|language=Italian|date=11 February 2017}}</ref> According to the ''[[Daily Mirror]]'', Deulofeu's style of play is comparable to that of [[Cristiano Ronaldo]], due to a shared direct approach.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/gerard-deulofeu-scouting-report-evertons-2045388|title=Gerard Deulofeu scouting report: Everton's new Barcelona boy is more Ronaldo than Messi|work=Daily Mirror|last=Hall|first=Pete|date=11 July 2013|accessdate=6 February 2014}}</ref> Regarded as a promising young player, in 2012, he was included by ''[[Don Balón]]'' in their list of the 101 most exciting prospects born after 1991,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tuttomercatoweb.com/inter/?action=read&idnet=dHV0dG9jaGFtcGlvbnMuaXQtMTQ1OTE|title=101 prospetti per il futuro. Ecco la lista di Don Balon|publisher=TuttoMercatoWeb.com|language=Italian|author1=Tommaso Maschio|date=13 November 2012|accessdate=22 February 2017}}</ref> while in January 2014, he was named by ''[[The Observer]]'' as one of the ten most promising young players in Europe.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2014/jan/19/next-10-big-things-europes-top-youngsters|title=The next 10 big things: Europe's top youngsters and stars of the future|work=The Guardian|date=19 January 2014|accessdate=6 February 2014}}</ref> Looking back in 2018, ''[[NBC Sports]]''' Daniel Karell said of Deulofeu: "In his younger days, the now 24-year-old winger was a dynamic and lightning-quick attacker with a [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|central midfielder]]’s technique to boot".<ref name="NBC" />
